group_1.textRight: The Uwasa seems to be drawn@to the "desire to meet".
And then it puts you in a nightmare?

group_1.textLeft: Yes... Just like the Radio Wave Girl rumor, right?

group_1.textRight: When a girl thinks about@wanting to meet someone...
That's when the Radio Wave Girl shows up.
They'll hear "You want to meet me?"
And then it's like "Let's dream together."
The girls are told "Come with me"@and almost get kidnapped.

group_1.textLeft: Whoah, kidnapped? Creepyyy...

group_1.textRight: But you haven't been kidnapped.

group_1.textLeft: Yes... The Uwasa said "You want to meet me?"
And also, "Let's go together."
Does the Uwasa not want to meet you, Sana?

group_1.textRight: ...No, I believe the Uwasa does want Sana.
It's based off of Ai, after all.
I understand why it would want to take Sana.
The Uwasa reacts to a person's "desire to meet".
Which stems from Ai's own@"desire to meet someone".
And that someone, I believe...is Sana.

group_1.textLeft: (Is that...true...?)

group_1.textRight: But even if it wants to steal Sana,@the Uwasa can't actually achieve that.
It was born incomplete during the failed experiment.
I don't think the Uwasa has@the magic to fulfill its [textBlue:Rumor].

group_1.textLeft: It targets young women indiscriminately because@it doesn't know who it wants to meet.
It doesn't have the power to take@someone's consciousness entirely.
Instead, they merely end up passing out.

group_1.textRight: That makes sense...
Now we understand how the Uwasa works.
Our next imperative is figuring@out how to draw out the Uwasa.

group_1.textLeft: Draw it out?

group_1.textRight: If the Uwasa doesn't have a body,@it can't be destroyed, right?

group_1.textLeft: Ah, I get it.
...Touka...

group_1.textRight: Yes...?

group_1.textLeft: Once more... I want to be the@bait that summons the Uwasa!

group_1.textRight: Sana...?!
But when the Uwasa got you,@it just ran away, didn't it?

group_1.textLeft: That's true...
The Uwasa was calling out my name...
It really seemed like it wanted to take me away...
So if I summon it again, it should show up again.
That way, Touka and everyone can@focus on examining the Uwasa.
Maybe we can find a way to draw it out...?

group_1.textRight: It might be possible to examine@it in this environment.
But...we're not sure what might@happen next if we do that.

group_1.textLeft: I'd be lying if I said I wasn't afraid.
...But if the Uwasa is the way it is because of me...
Then I have to be the one to stop it...
Besides, I've troubled everyone enough already...
I want to do what I can!

group_1.textRight: You know, since Sana used@to be the Radio Wave Girl...
I didn't feel comfortable talking about@it when I don't know all the details.

group_1.textLeft: ...I'm sorry, I didn't mean to trouble you.

group_1.textRight: No, we're sorry as well.

group_1.textLeft: It's just, I hope you're not pushing yourself, Sana...
This must be an important place to you, Sana...
I'm sure there must be a lot on your mind.
I used to rely on others, and I still do,@so I want to change that part of myself...

group_1.textRight: Sana, you've done more than enough...

group_1.textLeft: But...I can't even do anything for myself,@I'm just a nuisance...

group_1.textRight: You aren't...
Sana, Ai is very important to you.
We all know that.
That's why we avoided talking@about the rumor and the news...
So I don't think you're a nuisance, Sana!

group_1.textLeft: Iroha...

group_1.textRight: Iroha is right...
...And that's why I think we should leave it@up to you to get the Uwasa's attention.

group_1.textLeft: Thank you so much...

group_1.textRight: That said, don't push yourself.
If anything happens, we're here to support you.
